articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One on One With Tom Steyer
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton talks with Tom Steyer about why he’s donating so much to get Democrats elected this midterm and the recent bomb threats he’s been a target of.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Crunching The Numbers with Kornacki
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton and Steve Kornacki break down the numbers of the most exciting races for the midterms.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Who Has The Momentum?
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton is joined by Joe Madison, Hugh Hewitt and Betsy Woodruff to discuss the last weekend before the midterm elections, and discuss the hottest races and who to look out for.

articles.title: PoliticsNation 11/04/18
articles.description: PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader.
articles.content: PoliticsNation with Al Sharpton 11/04/18 PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Latest MSNBC videos

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gina Rodriguez: Elected officials need to take care of Puerto Rico
articles.description: In the final days before the midterm elections, Gina Rodriguez, America Ferrera and other Latina actors rallied in Kissimmee, Florida, for Democratic candidate for governor Andrew Gillum. They appealed to Latino voters on the issues of Puerto Rico hurricane r…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Katyal: "Even the most conservative jurist like Justice Scalia would laugh this argument out of court."
articles.description: Supreme Court lawyer and Former Acting Solicitor General Neal Katyal explains why President Trump's proposal to end birthright citizenship is unconstitutional

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Actor on President Trump: "He's a one-punch fighter."
articles.description: Actor and activist Jesse Williams on why he's encouraging people to get out and vote.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Maxine Waters: American people in final analysis will understand how divisive president is
articles.description: The midterm elections could see Rep. Maxine Waters become the chair of U.S. House Committee on Financial Services, if Democrats take back control. Waters and Joy Reid discuss Donald Trump, the horrible threats against her life, and more.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: TV legend Norman Lear: Andrew Gillum is a giant talent in politics
articles.description: Florida governor candidate Andrew Gillum is being supported by legendary TV producer Norman Lear, who has been campaigning for the Democratic mayor of Tallahassee. Lear tells Joy Reid, ‘I've known Andrew Gillum for 25 years... He's a glorious man.’

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Judd Legum: Will a surge of Democrats and Independents make Iowa race more competitive?
articles.description: The Iowa midterm elections see Steve King facing off with Democrat J.D. Scholten in a tight race. Judd Legum of the political newsletter Popular Information joins Joy Reid to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Jaclyn Corin: I appreciate candidates that voice opinions on gun control
articles.description: In the midterm elections, many young Democrats are focusing on a push for better gun control. Millennial activists discuss voters in their demographic galvanized by this issue with Joy Reid.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Tiffany Cross: I'm actually not counting out Beto O’Rourke
articles.description: The Texas Senate race is one of the pivotal races that could determine control of the United States Senate. Can Beto O’Rourke beat incumbent Ted Cruz? Joy Reid and her panel discuss also discuss the contentious Missouri Senate race.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Georgia Democrats respond to Kemp's claim of attempted voter hack
articles.description: After Republican candidate for Georgia governor Brian Kemp claimed the voter registration system was hacked, his Democratic opponent Stacey Abrams called it a “desperate attempt” to distract voters. NBC’s Beth Fouhy reports.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fernand Amandi: Florida governor race a moral crossroads for U.S.
articles.description: Florida races in the midterm elections are neck and neck, with the governor race between Andrew Gillum and Ron DeSantis being called by one guest in this special show from Fort Lauderdale, ‘a moral crossroads for the United States.’ Joy Reid and her panel dis…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Matters? Part Five: California
articles.description: Ahead of the midterm elections, NBC’s Jacob Soboroff goes to California’s Orange County, a stronghold Republican area, to learn about what political issues concern voters. Part 5 of the MSNBC Special, "What Matters."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Matters? Part Four: Texas
articles.description: NBC’s Jacob Soboroff heads to Texas’ 23rd congressional district, where Rep. Will Hurd, the Republican incumbent, is being challenged by Democratic candidate Gina Ortiz Jones. Locals explain they’re most concerned about jobs and farming – and a few reveal the…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Matters? Part Three: Florida
articles.description: In Part 3 of the MSNBC Special "What Matters," Jacob Soboroff visited the state that always seems to matter in every American election: Florida.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Matters? Part Two: Staten Island
articles.description: NBC’s Jacob Soboroff heads to Staten Island to learn what matters most to voters in the Republican district in the overwhelmingly Democratic New York City.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Matters? Part One: Maine
articles.description: Ahead of the midterm elections, with everything at stake, MSNBC's Jacob Soboroff  talked to critical voters in the swing districts,  to find out what matters most to the people whose votes could matter the most.  In part 1 of the MSNBC special, he took a clos…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Obama vs. Trump on the campaign trail
articles.description: It’s still the midterms, but we’re seeing president vs. president on the campaign trail.  MSNBC’s David Gura has more on how former President Obama and President Trump are trading barbs on the stump.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why Dems, GOP are both heavily invested in Missouri
articles.description: It’s still a toss-up for the U.S. senate seat in Missouri between incumbent Claire McCaskill and Republican Josh Hawley.  NBC Road Warrior Morgan Radford has more on why both parties are so heavily invested in the “show me” state.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Can all-star support help Abrams win GA gubernatorial race?
articles.description: Former President Barack Obama and Oprah Winfrey have both stumped in Georgia for Democratic gubernatorial candidate Stacey Abrams.  NBC Road Warrior Beth Fouhy has more from Atlanta.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Michael Moore: Take Trump seriously and don't listen to Pelosi or the polls
articles.description: Filmmaker and activist Michael Moore is cautioning voters against taking the election for granted, like he did in 2016, when he predicted Trump's victory. He says  Rep. Nancy Pelosi is doing a disservice in predicting a Democratic win in the House.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Capt. Sullenberger: Vote against Republican control
articles.description: Capt. Sully Sullenberger has a message for the American people: "everyone, everywhere must vote." Capt. Sully urges voters to save our democracy from a President that is not capable or willing to change.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How local issues on the ballot could have a national impact
articles.description: Midterm elections are 3 days away, and local issues are poised to have a national impact. Former Congressman Steve Israel and former Republican strategist Steve Schmidt share their thoughts on the midterms with Stephanie Ruhle.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Evangelical Christians expected to go red on Tuesday
articles.description: One voting bloc is expected to go red on Tuesday – Evangelical Christians. Stephanie Ruhle and former speechwriter for President George W. Bush, Peter Wehner tell you why younger Evangelicals may not be guaranteed to vote Republican come Tuesday.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Why aren’t Republicans focused on the economy ahead of midterms?
articles.description: Stephanie Ruhle explains how the current economy isn’t exactly helping everyone – including Republican candidates at the polls. Weighing in: CNBC Contributor Josh Brown, former Congressman Steve Israel, former Republican strategist Steve Schmidt, and Vanity F…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How could Puerto Rican voters affect the midterms?
articles.description: Hurricane Maria forced tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans to flee the island and move to the mainland. Stephanie Ruhle and MSNBC Correspondent Trymaine Lee break down how those Puerto Rico residents could have a huge impact in Tuesday’s election – especially …
